creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: Text of the Tale of Ise in one volume, brocade cover with peony design and outside label by the calligrapher. In 6 quires of smooth tan paper: 1) 6 and 7 pages, 2) 7 and 7 pages, 3) 7 and 7 pages, 4) 7 and 7 pages, 5 6 and 6 pages, 6) 6 and 3 pages. The first two sides are blank, and at the end the text is followed by two blank sides, colophon page, and blank side. Colophon reads: I have written this Ise Monogatari on order and with shameless crudity, inking my worn-out brush. Autumn. Kambun 2 [1662].
marks: Colophon reads: (I have written this Ise Monogatar
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink on paper
title: The Tale of Ise
